column4: we'll see if ooo2 is releasable by free software vendors at all :)
yes, if you have the gnome-support package instlled
iirc, sid at least has it
it has to work too? some people ;)
you can set it up just like you have debian now. that's what i did
that's why we have unstable. no worries about releases :)
that's how i see it. it's unstable, frozen and debugged from time to time
might be historical. xscreensaver is not a gnome component
companies will pay good money for support. that's how red hat, hp and novell make money. not software
right, what i'm wondering about specifically is if the repositories will become restricted in any way in the future
yes. companies have hoped for good professional debian support for years. now they have ubuntu
progeny and others have done it too, with varying success
it's a consideration. so far they've concentrated on polisihing debian
